page.title: 02NW.SHERBORNE:TRENT BARROW
page.content: Trent Barrow is a strange{wooded hill one kilometre east of the village of Trent. There is a pond in the middle of the hill, it is said that nobody knows how deep the pond is. There is a{legend}about a coach and horses which lost its way one winter and disappeared mysteriously and has never been seen since. The legend says that you can hear the sound of hooves at night-time. It is thought that the Barrow used to be a{marl pit.}Marl is a sort of clay which was used on the fields to improve the soil. The top of the hill is covered with trees and undergrowth, the sides of the hill are planted with European Larch. In the season there is pheasant {shooting}every two weeks: local men go beating.
